author: pquerna
msg: If the MPM supports serf in its core, use this to drive the proxied request
completely async from the original thread.
Right now it uses a 100ms timer to determine when the request is actaully complete,
but I think this can be removed in the long run with a better mechanism.

author: pquerna
msg: If serf is available, compile in driving the serf event loop from inside the
Add a new MPM Query to determine if an MPM supports this.

author: dblevins
msg: OPENEJB-1012: Multi-threaded Singleton Lazy Instantiation Issue
New code uses an AtomicReference to hold a FutureTask object.  The thread to win the Atomic compare and swap operation is the thread that will construct the singleton via futureTask.run()

author: veithen
msg: Compiling the code twice doesn't make it better: removed testSourceDirectory in those modules where it had the same value as sourceDirectory.
